summary: why do jonsas like you send hate to everyone and then wonder why we all hate you
question: why do jonsas like you send hate to everyone and then wonder why we all hate you
answer: i’m not a jonsa but i’m aware that y’all hate them for shipping your precious hero with (the obviously superior) sansa. most jonsa hate is sansa hate, that’s why many got/asoiaf fandoms hate it. it’s because you have trash opinions of sansa and/or you ship her with a gross character. i see right through y’all

blog.title: I'm not a Stark. | You are to me.

tags: another useless meta sponsored by the tiresome discussions I keep having
summary: The curse of the original outline
title: The curse of the original outline
body:
Ok, so every time I start talking to some… let’s call them Sansa-sceptics, because “haters” is such a strong word, and many of them just don’t care about her enough to be hateful. Having established that - every time I start talking to Sansa-sceptics about how unreal her supposed betrayal is at this point, they often strike me with: “But in the original outline!”

A confession: I’ve never read it. (Well, up until now I haven’t.) I’ve read OF it (a lot), so I was familiar with the main idea, you know, the doomed love triangle, evil!Jaime, Tyrion burning Winterfell, Dany killing Drogo, and of course Sansa being wed to Joffrey, but yesterday was my first time actually reading Martin’s letter word by word.

I’m not going to point out how useless having seen this outline seems now, when almost all of those storyarcs had been changed/ditched. I just wanna talk about Sansa.

Below I quote all the passages that mention her specifically:

Each of the contending families will learn it has a member of dubious loyalty in its midst. Sansa Stark, wed to Joffrey Baratheon, will bear him a son, the heir to the throne, and when the crunch comes she will choose her husband and child over her parents and siblings, a choice she will later bitterly rue. Tyrion Lannister, meanwhile, will befriend both Sansa and her sister Arya, while growing more and more disenchanted with his own family.

Yes, that’s all of them. One.

This is the solid proof I was told would change my viewpoint completely? I mean, wow. She chose her husband and her child over her other family members, WHAT A BITCH. She should have killed Joffrey and kidnap their son, the heir to the throne. Or better kill the baby too, I mean he’s got Lannister blood, what good could come of this? 

There is a mention of Joffrey’s brutality in the outline, but there’s also a mention of him being mimed by Robb in a battle, so the cowardly, sadistic moron of a kid that we know as Joffrey Baratheon was probably not on Martin’s mind at the time. And we all remember Sansa’s feelings towards him after Ned’s death, all the hatred, the moment when she was ready to push him from the walls, the time when she struggled not to smile when he “humiliated” her and broke off the engagement. She despised him. If she chose that life willingly in the outline, it was for another Joffrey. If she was forced–well, that’s not really a treason, is it? 

Also… I wonder. In the original outline Dany kills Drogo, and supposedly the whole second book of the trilogy was to be centred around the “invasion” of her Dothraki on Westeros. Not very hero-like, is it? And yet I never hear: “But in the original outline!” in her case.

Or Jaime. The greatest douchebag turned… hero? (whatever his endgame will be, the redemption arc is quite obvious and, what can I say, well deserved) in the original outline appears to be a worse version of Cersei, seemingly unable to love anything or anyone (he kills everyone ahead of him in the line of succession so probably all of his children–if they are his children in this version, I’m guessing rather not, so maybe nieces and nephews–plus Cersei herself, or whoever was Joff’s mother supposed to be, maybe even Sansa’s son?). And yet–yes, you guessed right–NO FREAKING “BUT IN THE ORIGINAL OUTLINE!”

It doesn’t matter. It’s useless. It’s fun to compare, sure, but it’s not an argument–for or against anything. It does tell us a few things (for example that Martin is apparently not opposed to the half-siblings turned cousins turned lovers scenario, not that it must necessarily happen just because it was hinted then) but it does not determine any of our characters’ storylines. And once and for all: it does not suggest that Sansa is the ultimate betrayer.

blog.name: wallofprompts
blog.title: The Wall of Prompts
blog.description: GoT prompts. Grab a prompt for a fic or left one. Main ships Jonerys and Gendrya, but everyone is welcome. Check the tags list for prompts.

summary: Kingslayer and the jewel of the north
title: Kingslayer and the jewel of the north
body:
I had this dream where Robert removes Jaime from KG after he kills King Aerys, so Jaime lives in Casterly rock as the heir and doesn’t father Cersei’s children. Jon Arryn isn’t killed since there is no secret, so the starks don’t go south until hoster Tully dies.

Then Jaime and Sansa meet at a tourney.

Then Jaime and Sansa meet at a tourney.

question: unpopular asoiaf opinions
answer:
• sansa was always a great character
  • jon snow isn’t a good deconstruction of the fantasy hero trope
  • daenerys isn’t well written (like her internal conflict is the best part of her but everything external is simply terrible)
  • catelyn owed jon nothing
  • ned stark isn’t a good parent to his non robb and arya kids
  • grrm could have done more with robert baratheon
  • young griff is a good character. yes everything comes to him easily but honestly if he had a hard time conquering westeros after a civil war of that scale….
  • rhaegar/lyanna sucks
  • cersei’s chapters should have started in asos
  • sansan isn’t happening
  • theon and jeyne didn’t deserve what happened to them, you soulless shitstains. idc jeyne made arya cry every damn day of her life
  • the targaryens are very boring. seriously, george had so much inspiration in powerful inbred families from our world and he decides to give us the most meh family, gives them dragons and then he overfocuses on them as if he wants nothing more than to show us how dull they are
  • sam’s chapters are boring but they are important. same with davos and areo 
  • dorne was 100% right to defend itself from foreign invasions. it’s a good thing that they hired assassins to try and kill aegon and visenya. torturing rhaenys is a-okay considering the damage that she did. daeron i deserved to die, peace banner or not
  • elia was not a harpy, an adultress or a doormat and rhaegar wrong her in many ways

blog.name: melissa-blogs
blog.title: The Inner Workings of a Fangirl's mind

summary: 🍁 Happy October 1st! 🍁 As promised, 👉here are the fall desktop wallpapers👈  You guys will have to forgive me but I’ve had no...
caption:
🍁 Happy October 1st! 🍁

As promised, 👉here are the fall desktop wallpapers👈 
You guys will have to forgive me but I’ve had no time to edit mobile versions 😫

Click Here for Header Gifs.  Here for all Wallpapers.

Notes & Credits below

I know I made most of these pretty dark [as far as the palette goes] which wasn’t my original intent but as I was searching for new/different images to use than the one’s I’ve previously used I knew I really wanted screenshots of their argument scene, which is, as we all know, fairly dimly lit. After messing with those images they reminded me of the juxtaposition of their reunion scenes and well… one thing led to another and I ended up really liking the visual parallels between the scenes so they accidentally became my focus for this set of designs.

When I first messed with those two scenes I was getting some strong spooky vibes from all the black/orange coloring which led to my glitch version. So really the glitch one is meant to be a sort of Halloween version (as is the header gif I made for it). Okay, enough ranting.. if you made it here thanks for reading this far ❤

Credits

  • Leaves & flower pngs x MyLightBlueSky on DeviantArt
  • Fire & dirt leaves photographs x Annie Spratt

blog.name: secretsolstice
blog.title: Secrets within
blog.description:
“Do. Or do not. There is no try.”
I really like everything and anything. Game of Thrones related content to Naruto content. Anything that's good. I read books too sometimes

summary: Emergency Awesome posted this new video “Game Of Thrones Season 8 Jon Snow Daenerys Preview and Targaryen History Explained” and...
body:
Emergency Awesome posted this new video “Game Of Thrones Season 8 Jon Snow Daenerys Preview and Targaryen History Explained” and I stopped watching after he said that the queen is like Dany.  Even though Emergency Awesome said  “Jaehaerys married his younger sister, Alysanne.”  

MY thoughts went straight to: Sansa is younger than Jon.

Bruh.

BRUH.

YOU GUYS.

This is just one more small irrelevant parallel to Sansa and the queen, but like??? I’m taking what I can get.

tags: (actually i literally copied Bob Ross to the best of my memory)
summary: Yesterday, while I waited for my sister to buy her phone at Best Buy, I found myself with nothing to do but draw on those...
body:
Yesterday, while I waited for my sister to buy her phone at Best Buy, I found myself with nothing to do but draw on those try-for-yourself iPads while I charged my phone. Adobe Sketch turns out to not be that bad?

(Of course I had to draw Sansa Stark, since she’s my muse for this year)
